word_mean: 惊厥，抽搐：随意肌不自主的单次或连续强烈收缩
又称“搐搦”。肌肉不由自主地突然而迅速抽动的表现。

sentence.Network_en: A sudden convulsion shook him, and he fell to the ground.
sentence.Network_cn: 一阵突然的痉挛使他全身发抖, 摔倒在地上.

sentence.Network_en: The child's nervous illness often threw her into convulsion.
sentence.Network_cn: 这孩子的神经性疾病常使她产生痉挛.

sentence.Network_en: The country was in ruin and convulsion.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个国家没落于动乱之中.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 惊厥（convulsion）俗称抽筋、抽风、惊风，也称抽搐。表现为阵发性四肢和面部肌肉抽动，多伴有两侧眼球上翻、凝视或斜视，神志 …
急救英语_百度文库 ... excessive sweating 多汗 12、 convulsion 抽搐惊厥 13、 inflammation 炎症发炎 14、.
痉字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 痉笑 jìngxiào 风强病。也称“痉挛”〖 convulsion〗 痉 jìng.
专业英语-光电英语词汇(C3) - 豆丁网 ... convolutional coding 卷积编码 convulsion 震动 Cooke eyepice 柯克目镜.

list.abs: 热痉挛(febrile convulsion)二、 诊断依据  1. 发热、咳嗽2天。
热性惊厥(febrile convulsion)，由于绝大多数患儿是在体温突然和显著增高时发作，国内习惯使用高热惊厥名称。本病是婴幼儿最常见 …
tonic contraction 紧张性收缩tonic convulsion 强直性抽搐tonic discharge pattern 紧张性放射类型紧张性放射类型.
医学及制药专业词汇 - 翻译学习资料区大家论坛 ... clone 细胞系 clonic convulsion 阵挛性惊厥 clonic spasm 阵挛性惊厥.
convulsive reflex 痉挛反射convulsive therapy 惊厥疗法convulsive tic 面肌抽搐

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (originally in the sense 'cramp, spasm'): from Latin convulsio(n-), from the verb convellere (see convulse)

entry.def: If someone has convulsions, they suffer uncontrollable movements of their muscles.

entry.tran: (国家、体系、组织发生的)动乱，骚乱
entry.def: If there are convulsions in a country, system, or organization, there are major unexpected changes in it.

example.ex: ...the political convulsions that led to de Gaulle's return to power in May 1958.
example.tran: 促使戴高乐在1958年5月重新上台的政治动乱

example.ex: ...the great convulsion of the eighteenth century.

means.word_mean: 4. a physical disturbance such as an earthquake or upheaval

auth_sentence.content: Three per cent of children have at least one febrile convulsion.
auth_sentence.res_content: Three per cent of children have at least one febrile convulsion.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Three per cent of children have at least one febrile convulsion.

auth_sentence.content: They also have a one in three risk of a convulsion during a subsequent illness.
auth_sentence.res_content: They also have a one in three risk of a convulsion during a subsequent illness.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They also have a one in three risk of a convulsion during a subsequent illness.

auth_sentence.content: She turned away, shuddering off a convulsion as best she could, but another came and she was restless.
auth_sentence.res_content: She turned away, shuddering off a convulsion as best she could, but another came and she was restless.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She turned away, shuddering off a convulsion as best she could, but another came and she was restless.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 起痉挛的, 痉挛性的
stems_affixes.word_buile: convulse[v.使震动,震惊;使抽筋]+ive……的→adj.起痉挛的, 痉挛性的
convulse[v.使震动,震惊;使抽筋]+ion表名词→n.骚动,痉挛
revulse[v.使极其厌恶, 激起……的强烈反感]+ion表名词→n.抽回;反感;厌恶
con一起+vuls收缩,撕开+e→使收缩到一起→使抽筋

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使极其厌恶, 激起……的强烈反感
stems_affixes.word_buile: re回+vuls收缩,撕开+e→收缩回去→对……反感

sentences.en: The doctor treated him for convulsions.
The patient lost consciousness and went into convulsions.
sentences.cn: 病人失去知觉，开始抽搐起来。

sentences.en: A sudden convulsion shook him, and he fell to the ground.
sentences.cn: 一阵突然的痉挛使他全身发抖，摔倒在地上。

sentences.en: She went into convulsions several hours after the accident and had to be rushed to a hospital.
sentences.cn: 事故发生几小时后她开始抽搐,被迅速送进了医院。

sentences.en: The story was so funny that we were all in convulsions.
sentences.cn: 那个故事真滑稽,引得我们捧腹大笑。

sentences.en: The country was in ruin and convulsion.
sentences.cn: 这个国家没落于动乱之中。
